channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Repeated dog weeing and dog fouling, 24th January
item.description:
Repeated dog weeing and fouling on her border with the pavement - 66 Ratcliff Lawns, Southam
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 37 Ratcliff Lawns, Southam
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog poo bin still overflowing, 24th January
item.description:
I reported this last week but it’s still not been emptied. As you leave Moorend Road into the path leading to Charlton Park, as soon as you hit the first triangle of grass - it’s that dog poo bin. Please can you arrange for it to be emptied? Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 47 King William Drive, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes Towards Gloucester just before heading to the motorway junction, 23rd January
item.description:
A couple of very nasty potholes since roadworks abs lane changes were made.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A40, The Reddings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fix at the end of Kipling Road of a very poor quality, 23rd January
item.description:
The fix that was made at the end of Kipling Road two weeks ago is already deteriorating back to gravel I think the council needs its money back and they need the team to come and fix it properly

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 255 Gloucester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lights out at Gloucester Road crossing to Cheltenham spa station, 23rd January
item.description:
The traffic lights appear to have failed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 255 Gloucester Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Litter and industrial refuse, 23rd January
item.description:
Huge amounts of litter and industrial refuse (plastic sheets) on the verge of the motorway
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): M5, Cheltenham

item.title: Large amount of litter, 23rd January
item.description:
Large amounts of litter on the verges and particularly in the layby
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Michael Deane BADGEWORTH, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unsafe pavement, 23rd January
item.description:
House owner out side no 37 has dropped the kerb out side his house and replaced the paving stones with tarmac. The quality of work is very poor, presenting a significant trip hazard risk to walkers. Not even sure if the work has been approved?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 33 Beechurst Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside of Sainsburies on Bath Road, the pavement juts out in line with the allocated parking. There appears to be a metal pole in this jut, 23rd January
item.description:
The pole I presume used to have a yellow and blue reflective or light up sign to show road users the pavement juts out. In the daylight it doesn't cause an issue as mostly cars are parked in the allocated parking .. but at night when there are no cars there and nothing but a metal pole it becomes an issue. I have personally had to swerve twice to make sure I don't drive into it. Because the pavement juts out, you.dint naturally get led to move over.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Podium MONTPELLIER, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large amounts of litter, 22nd January
item.description:
There is a horrible amount of litter on both sides of the road at Nettleton, repeatedly. Please could this be cleaned up and cameras installed to catch the litter louts?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A417, Birdlip
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign which states parking restrictions has been hit and is leaning., 22nd January
item.description:
Sign is broken has been for a while & is getting worse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Hucclecote Road, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 x large potholes, 21st January
item.description:
On the new surface of the A40, heading out of Cheltenham from Arle Court towards the motorway slip road. 2 large potholes have developed on the inside lane. These are quite large in size and if hit when travelling at 60 mph a puncture would be quite possible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A40, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A number of large potholes all the way down Buttermilk Lane, Churchdown, Gloucester, 21st January
item.description:
There are a number of potholes from the entrance to Buttermilk Lane all the way down the single track Lane. Some very large holes

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 3 Chadbournes, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Can somebody pick it up please?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Enterprise House, 36 Central Way, Cheltenham Trade Park

item.title: Drain cover is loose and very loud, 21st January
item.description:
Right outside Barnwood Construction and pretty unavoidable.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Barnwood Road, Gloucester

item.title: Flytipping, 21st January
item.description:
Some black bags have been dumped in this fly tipping hot spot lay-by. Please be careful as the last lot was bags of rotten meat! Blurh!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 87 Sussex Gardens, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bollards in carriageway are too dirty to see when driving, 21st January
item.description:
The row of bollards in the carriageway are so filthy now that they are very hard to see. They are now the same colour as the dirty road surface. I almost hit them when driving in the dark. They are a risk in the daytime too. Please can these be cleaned as soon as possible so that they are more visible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Larches Cirencester Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement impassable. Undulating surface., 20th January
item.description:
Pavement blocked off, due to undulating surface. School students for both Junior and Senior Schools, as well as other pedestrians, having to walk on the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 24 Vicarage Lane, Brockworth
Report on FixMyStreet
